To find how many bricks Bernie used yesterday, we start with the $\purpleD{99}$ bricks the chimney has now and subtract the $\maroonD{32}$ bricks added today.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/641741ff438f616e63316d9325bc7e2473bd8bf3)

$\purpleD{99}-\maroonD{32} = \blueE{\Box}$

Let's subtract to find how many bricks were on the chimney when he started.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/7092d9f239c5dad06b24ced09d98007297831b94)

$\purpleD{99}-\maroonD{32}= \blueE{67}$

question.content:
Bernie used several bricks yesterday when he started to build the chimney.  Today he added $32$ more bricks.  Now, the chimney has a total of $99$ bricks.  

**How many bricks did Bernie use yesterday?**  

[[☃ numeric-input 1]] bricks
